form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Request That Applicant For Naturalization Appear For Interview

full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/14/2023 U.S. Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service Request That Applicant For Naturalization Appear For Interview 1301 Clay Street Room 380-N Oakland, California 94612-5217 July 8, 1998 A042 939 792/JF ABEL DASILVA 20101 EDWIN MARKHAM CASTRO VALLEY CA 94552 COPY CC: Your application for naturalization has been received and arrangements have been made for an examination on your application. Please come to Date: WEDNESDAY, JULY 22, 1998 OAKLAND NATURALIZATION OFFICE Time: 3:30 PM 1301 CLAY ST. ROOM 380-N, North Tower DL OAKLAND CA 94612-5217 (Please do not bring young children to the interview -- our seating space is limited.) The proceeding will take about two hours. If for any reason you cannot keep this appointment, return this letter immediately with your explanation and a request for a new appointment; otherwise, no further action will be taken on your application. If you are applying for citizenship for yourself, you will be tested on your knowledge of the government of the United States and its history. You will also be tested on reading, writing, and speaking English, unless on the date you filed your application, you had been living in the United States for at least 15 years as a lawful permanent resident and were over 55 years old, or 20 years as a lawful permanent resident and were over 50 years of age, or you are physically unable to read, write, or speak. YOU MUST BRING WITH YOU: * This letter. * Alien Registration Receipt Card. * Any draft card/or evidence of Selective Service Registration * Your passports and/or any other documents you have which you used in connection with any entries in the United States. YOU MUST ALSO BRING WITH YOU WHAT IS NOTED BELOW: If applying for NATURALIZATION AS THE SPOUSE of a United States Citizen; * Your marriage certificate. * Proof of death or divorce for each prior marriage of yourself or spouse. * Your spouse's birth or naturalization certificate or certificate of citizenship. If applying for Naturalization on behalf of your child (children); * The child(children) for whom you filed application for naturalization. * Adoption decree(s), and a summary translation(s) in English if in a foreign language. A summary translation is a condensation or abstract of the text. * Your United States birth certificate or certificate of naturalization or citizenship. * Your marriage certificate. If applying for NATURALIZATION as a member of the United States ARMED FORCES; * Your discharge certificate, or form DD214. Please keep this appointment, even if you do not have all the items indicated above. Form N-430(Rev.12/30/91)N
